intro: Angorkis citrangis, commonly known as the golden flame orchid, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid forest environments. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
